entry.title: on S/4HANA, if I use ADT to create custom CDS views, is it keeping the core clean?
entry.content:
Using ADT, if I were to create custom CDS views in S/4HANA on PCE or in S/4HANA on premise so I can create custom data products in SAP BDC, am I still keeping the core clean?   

Thanks.

Regards,

Mel Calucin

entry.title: Not able to edit Purchase requisition due to In Process Externally
entry.content:
Hi,

There are 5 Purchase Requisition IN PH1 system which are converted from Planned orders and now Business is not able to delete or not able to convert in to Purchase Order due to Below Error.

"You cannot edit the PR item.

Message no. MMPUR_REQ_COMMON132

Diagnosis

If you can"t edit the PR item, it"s because its status is one of the following:

¬∑ In Process Externally

¬∑ Rejected Externally "

We have run the correction program from SE38 - RLORD035 and tried to delete the Purchase Requisition but it is not deleting.

Can you please suggest us how we can delete these Purchase Requisitions

entry.title: Advanced Valuation - Impairment - Reconciliation Account
entry.content:
Dear All,

when using the credit risk based impairment in the advanced valuation we can assign the P/L account for the adjustment to be posted however the offsetting account is the reconciliation account form the BP/Customer. Is there an option to assign a deviating recon account instead of the recon from the customer master? 

Many thanks,

Sebastian

entry.title: Hierarchy Set selection in ME21N and ME51N
entry.content:
We have activated Item Hierarchies in Purchasing in development 110.

We have also created set in Manage Model Product Specifications.

We do not have selection option of set which was created in app "Manage Model Product Specifications" to select in ME21N or ME51N.

Reproduce steps:

1. Open ME21N transaction

2. Select create hierarchy set

3. Enter set description

4. Select create hierarchy item.

but not able to select already defined set. (set is defined in Manage Model Product Specifications)

entry.title: CAMT.053 no longer interprets the data medium reference number with algorithm 019
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

My customer has switched his electronic bank statment from MT940 to CAMT.053. This has generally worked well. However, there are problems with a specific business transaction:

Previously (MT940), business transaction code 191 (Outgoing SEPA credit transfer) with interpretation algorithm 019 (reference number (DME management)) automatically cleared the subaccount because the payment medium was found.

Today (CAMT.053), the same posting rule and the same interpretation algorithm 019 is assigned to the external transaction PMNTICDTESCT:

- The reference number of the data carrier can be found in the bank statement in the field NtryDtls-->AddtlNtryInf  ("<AddtlNtryInf>Data Medium 0000079218 with 1 Credit Transfer</AddtlNtryInf>"

- The same content "Data Medium 0000079218 with 1 Credit Transfer"  is also transferred to the reference record (table FEBRE). 

But somehow the interpretation does not work, and I do not know why.

Can anyone help?

Thank you very much in advance for any advice. Best regards,

Rado

entry.title: Delivery date field update after PO confirmation posted
entry.content:
Subject: SAP Configuration Options for PO Delivery Date Update Behavior

Hi SAP Community 

I‚Äôm reaching out to explore whether there‚Äôs any SAP configuration that could help us address an issue.

Currently there are production delays or demand changes after PO confirmation  where we need to update the shipping mode or WROUTE at the PO item level. These changes affect lead times, and currently, the system automatically updates the delivery date in the delivery schedule tab (EKET-EIND).

Updating the delivery date after PO is confirmed is impacting our data analytics reports. Business is requiring to stop updating the delivery date in the delivery schedule tab (EKET-EIND). 

Before we consider any development, I‚Äôd like to know if there‚Äôs any standard configuration or enhancement option that could help us control or prevent the automatic update of the delivery date when ship mode or WROUTE changes‚Äîideally without affecting downstream logic.

Appreciate any guidance or suggestions you might have!

entry.title: Error message: FINOC165 and FINOC297 - Manage Cost Centers / F1443A
entry.content:
Hi there,

I hope you are well.


I can"t change the profit center of a cost center with postings, even if i reverse the entry.

 

I tried to implement the notes below, but without sucess:

3477968 

3514994

3567063 

 

We are in FPS 01 - product version (Onpremise). 

Note: Message 297 and 165 does not exist in OBA5 in S4HANA ON PREMISE 2023/FPS 01, I looked at another customer and it is available in S4HANA ON PREMISSE 2023/FPS 02, just 297 is available.

I appreciate your help with this.

 

Best Regards,

Ac√°cio

entry.title: Problem with activation of Business function (BS sets are not activated automatically)
entry.content:
Good day, we have new fresh system S/4HANA 2023 FPS03.

After initial configuration of system we tried to activate business function EA-HR (one of the main BF's) via standard SFW5 transaction.

But activation was not successful,  we got errors:

in text: 

Error when comparing BC Set EA-HR-AKH with customizing tables

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Activation of BC Set EA-HR-AKH terminated

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Error when comparing BC Set EA-HR-IMG with customizing tables

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Activation of BC Set EA-HR-IMG terminated

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Error when comparing BC Set EA-HR-MENU with customizing tables

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed

Activation of BC Set EA-HR-MENU terminated

Postprocessing necessary when upgrade/update completed"

If we check problem BC set EA-HR-AKH in SCPR20 transaction, we can see no activations logs:

Looks like SFW5 didn't try to activate it.

SFW_BROWSER shows next:

 

We have double checked all prerequisites:

1. User has SAP_ALL auth.

2. Client role is 'Customizing'.

3. System modifiable (SE06).

Also  Sapnotes  2313533 - SFW5: Termination of activation process,  

2313533 - SFW5: Termination of activation process, 

2770392 - SFW_BROWSER: This object is switched inconsistently  have been checked.

If you have any suggestions please help me.

Thanks in advance!

PS: Sorry for text formatting, I didn't find how to remove spaces between lines in new editor.

entry.title: ME21N copy qty from contract to PO
entry.content:
Hi, one of the contracts I work with have the quantity as kilometres, so the quantity could be any number from 8.000 to 56.986. 
After we select service the default qty is always ‚Äú1‚Äù so we have to go back check and manually change the qty on the PO to match the contract. Its very time consuming and leads to mistakes.

Is there a way to change make copy the whatever quantity it is on the contract?

Thanks

entry.title: Safe quantities in orders from being rescheduled?
entry.content:
Hello,

I am new to this community, so apologies already if my questionning is kinda vague, since I am also not very much into the technical things either üôÇ

However, since I am stuck within all the ressources that I have to find a solution, I am now reaching out to you.

Every night we have a job running called "rescheduler" which assigns quantities of products anew, according to priorities, but also to delivery date. So, for example it takes the product quantities from one order that has the delivery date set for 30.11. and adds them to an order with a delivery date 22.11. (even though this order was received already wayyy earlier). While this is quite nice for products that come regularly on stock, this is not so nice for products that are presold, where we rather require a first come, first serve setting (or even exit products).

So, I am wondering if there is any setting in SAP (maybe directly in the orders or with the article) that protects them from being touched by the "rescheduling"?

Any idea on this would be highly appreciated.

Thank you and best regards

Dietmar

entry.title: GL account determination vendor consignment process in sap
entry.content: We have created a new condition type which is linked to a GL account, and included it in the pricing procedure. This condition type and its corresponding GL account are correctly determined in standard purchase orders, but they are not being determined in consignment purchase orders when 411k posted. Where am i missing?

entry.title: S4 HANA On Prem.:asset values according to a reference date in Display Asset Master Worklist (F1592)
entry.content:
Dear All,

In tile ‚ÄúDisplay Asset Master Worklist (F1592)‚Äù, we wish we could display, the values of acquisition, the net asset values and the cumulated depreciations of the assets according to a selected reference date. That is, for past exercises or future exercises, we need to display those dynamic values, until the selected reference date, not necessarily the value at the end of an exercise.

Is is possible ? What are the precise fields we should call ? Or do we have to develop a specific to compute values from tables ?

Thank you very much for your help

entry.title: CDS view: Which annotations do I need for BW extraction? (CDS entity)
entry.content:
Dear all,

I need to extract data from a custom table in S/4HANA to BW/4HANA. To achieve this, I've created a CDS view defined as view entity.
When adding the annotation  Analytics.dataExtraction.enabled = true , the message "data extraction for CDS entity is not possible" is shown. I have read, that I should change the property "API state" of the CDS view to enable the use as "Remote API (Contract C2)". But when activating this, the following warnings are shown:

Use of annotation ABAPCATALOG.VIEWENHANCEMENTCATEGORY is not allowed.
Use of annotation ANALYTICS.DATACATEGORY is not allowed.
Use of annotation ANALYTICS.DATAEXTRACTION.DELTA.CHANGEDATACAPTURE.AUTOMATIC is not allowed.
Use of annotation ANALYTICS.DATAEXTRACTION.ENABLED is not allowed.

This is my CDS coding:

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'CDS-based BW extraction: table Zxxx_ABC'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: false
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #D,
    sizeCategory: #L,
    dataClass: #MIXED }
@analytics: {
    dataCategory: #FACT,
    dataExtraction: {
    enabled: true,
    delta.changeDataCapture.automatic: true }
}

define view entity ZC_BW_Zxxx_ABC as select from Zxxx_ABC
{
...
}

What is my mistake? Should I ignore the warning messages?

Thanks & kind regards,
Yvonne

entry.title: ZUB PO document type POs are dumping upon creation using ME21N of Fiori screen
entry.content:
Hello Team,

When Pulp Supply Chain/Logistics teams create purchase orders for stock transfers, the transaction is dumping when switching to Other purchase order, both in P11 and Q11environment.

This issue only happens with creating logistics PO with doc type ZUB in both GUI and Fiori, standard POs with doc type NB does not have this issue.

Kindly create new case and I will attach more documents.

Best Regards,

Sachin Kumbhar

entry.title: Modify Document Type when creating a new purchase request in SSAM
entry.content:
Hi experts!

Despite having the document types filtered in the configuration panel, the system only allows me to create a purchase requisition of type "NB". We need to be able to create a purchase requisition of type "Z" from SSAM. Where are the document types that can be created for purchase requisitions configured in SAP Service and Asset Manager 2410?

Thanks. Regards!
